item.title: Report E-2025020241
item.description:
Report E-2025020241

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon receipt of the trailer at Veolia in Henderson, CO., a release of liquid was observed. The trailer was offloaded and it was discovered that approximately 2 gallons of hazardous material had released out of a steel drum from a pinhole due to corrosion on the exterior of the container. The release impacted the trailer floor and dock beneath the trailer. Veolia personnel assisted a third party company with the spill cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2025020242
item.description:
Report E-2025020242

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4900
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon receiving a trailer, at Veolia's facility in Henderson, CO, a white powder was discovered. The trailer was unloaded, and a tote of sodium bisulfite was found to be missing a bung, which is the suspected source of the powder. The chemical vaporized and reacted with metallic components in the trailer resulting in the powder covered the trailer floor, walls, ceiling, and the top of containers. The container was closed properly and received at the facility.
